Templates.template:
new sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData
		dependents: [${dependents}], // sap.ui.core.Element[]
		dragDropConfig: [${dragDropConfig}], // sap.ui.core.dnd.DragDropBase[]
		fieldHelpDisplay: ${fieldHelpDisplay}, // (sap.ui.core.Element|string)
		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: [${fieldGroupIds}], // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		provideFallback: ${bProvideFallback}, // boolean
		width: ${width}, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
		dialogTitle: "${dialogTitle}", // string
		preferFrontCamera: ${bPreferFrontCamera}, // boolean
		frameRate: ${frameRate}, // float
		zoom: ${zoom}, // float
		keepCameraScan: ${bKeepCameraScan}, // boolean
		disableBarcodeInputDialog: ${bDisableBarcodeInputDialog}, // boolean
		scanSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		scanFail: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		inputLiveUpdate: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new BarcodeScannerButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getProvideFallback provideFallback} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getDialogTitle dialogTitle} : string
    • {@link #getPreferFrontCamera preferFrontCamera} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFrameRate frameRate} : float
    • {@link #getZoom zoom} : float
    • {@link #getKeepCameraScan keepCameraScan} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDisableBarcodeInputDialog disableBarcodeInputDialog} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:scanSuccess scanSuccess} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:scanFail scanFail} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:inputLiveUpdate inputLiveUpdate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton
Templates.helpDescription: A button control (displaying a barcode icon) to start the barcode scanning process. If the native scanning feature is not available or camera capability is not granted, the button is either hidden or it provides a fallback by opening a dialog with an input field where the barcode can be entered manually.

Templates.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.fireInputLiveUpdate
Templates.helpDescription: Fires event {@link #event:inputLiveUpdate inputLiveUpdate} to attached listeners.

Templates.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.fireScanSuccess
Templates.helpDescription: Fires event {@link #event:scanSuccess scanSuccess} to attached listeners.
